column4: i have read that it's a bad idea to use backports as it can cause dependency problems
I'm willing to take the chance. But at least I got newer versions of my software (example: GAIM)
ok then.  just thought i'd point it out.
he still wants the option of booting into a DE. :)
i guess you don't get many movies with dutch subtitles?
I also get a lot of dutch subtitles, but I rather read the english ones
do you get those old kungfu movies dubbed in german/dutch?  i'm wondering if they are as badly dubbed as the english ones. :)
I watched 1 kungfumovie once in german... for 1 minute.... I'd rather watch the english dubbed, or chinese subbed ("Unleashed" subbed was GREAT, by the way)
i use it's sound fix everytime i reinstall....then again, i'm 100% certain on what it all means...
what kind of 'sound fix' do you need? (and why do you say "everytime I reinstall".... that sounds nasty)
and about the reinstalls, one was my fault, one was when the packaging system completely borked, another was when i was having a logging out problem.
damn. That's just plain evil. I thought reinstalling so much was a windows thingie
well to be fair, with the exception of that packaging instance, i could probably have fixed the system if i was eager enough.
the same thing happened to me. I wanted to install ubuntu, so I burned the cd myself. 1 Day later, the Ubuntu discs arrived :-/
